metadata.titel_preek: Advent: The Season of Shadows and the Axe of Repentance

kernfrasen: The Advent clock points to an hour
Head-on collision with the powers of darkness
Where the battle line is drawn
Church has to take a beating
Axe is laid to the root

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: The hands on the church clock point to midnight.

mapping_structuur.doel_element: The return of Christ/End of the age

cognitieve_implicaties: The world is in a state of darkness and near-ending.
theologische_implicaties: God's timing is distinct from secular/economic timing.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Contrasts the 'bank clock' with the 'church clock' to re-activate the urgency of the Doomsday Clock trope.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher successfully links the 'Waiting' of the Doorkeeper (Relational/Architectural) with the 'Warfare' of the collision of ages (Military) through the unifying theme of 'Time/Urgency'.

incoherentie_punten.metafoor_a: GOD IS A LUMBERJACK (Axe to the root)
incoherentie_punten.metafoor_b: GOD IS A LIGHT SOURCE (John as spotlight)
incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The transition from the violent imagery of the axe to the passive imagery of the spotlight is abrupt.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: Spatializing the abstract 'turn of the ages' into a physical 'point of impact'.

sterktes.beschrijving: Revitalizes 'Repentance' by moving from the dead metaphor of 'feeling sorry' to the spatial metaphor of 'reorientation'.
sterktes.voorbeeld: Metanoia means to turn around, to reorient oneself in another direction.

risicos.beschrijving: The military imagery of 'taking a beating' and 'collision' might suggest a God who requires suffering.
risicos.voorbeeld: The church has to take a beating... where the battle line is drawn.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A dark, cold household at midnight where the master is missing.
sub_worlds: The wilderness of John the Baptist
The modern street with tinsel and bank clocks

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High - creates historical continuity of crisis.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Reinforces the hierarchy of the household and the master's right to order the servants.

verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: Advent as a 'Deep Place' of absence and vigilance.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly aligned with the Book of Common Prayer (Collect for Advent 1).

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by SPATIAL and TEMPORAL metaphors. It constructs a world where the church is an 'outpost' in a hostile time-zone. The use of the 'Axe' and 'Fruit' provides a necessary moral weight to the otherwise abstract 'waiting'.

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Deepen the source domain by describing the specific 'orders' or the 'smell' of the house the master left.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The master left the keys in the lock and the bread on the table.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The shift from 'Axe' to 'Power from outside'.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Link the 'Axe' to the 'Power'—the axe is the tool that clears the way for the new construction.

entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Balance with the 'Bearing Fruit' metaphor to ensure active ethical engagement.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To soften the 'beating' of the military metaphor; the 'collision' could be seen as a 'surgery' to remove the 'works of darkness'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using apocalyptic metaphors to disrupt comfortable secular schemas.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: Focuses on how 'Midnight' functions as a cognitive anchor for urgency rather than just a poetic mood.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Moves beyond 'experience' to the 'mapping' of the experience of waiting onto the concept of faith.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: Reveals that the preacher uses 'Verticality' (God coming down) and 'Force' (Collision) to explain why faith 'hurts'.

volledige_metafoor_lijst: Deepest place in the church year
Axe is laid to the root
appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Container' schema (In the church, in the world, in Christ).
